item.description: How to achieve earthquake forecasts? Earthquake weather? Earthquake climate? What do we need to do next? Physics-based models capable of data assimilation good approximation of the physics we want to model upscaling?

item.description: In my NZ project, I decided to plot my results entirely in Python to keep the pipeline simple. Turned out if you can fix the projection, you are half-way there.

item.title: Coulomb rate-and-state model
item.description: Combining Coulomb stress change with [[notes/Dieterich-JGR-1994-stress2rate|Dieterich1994]] to calculate rate change after sudden stress change. Reference seismicity rate r changes when a change in stress $\dot\tau$ occur and reach a new rate R as

item.title: Dieterich-JGR.1994-stress2rate
item.description: A constitutive law for rate of earthquake production and its application to earthquake clustering Authors: [[James H Dieterich]] Source Notes The essential concept of the analysis is the treatment of a seismically active volume of the Earth as having a population of sources that nucleate successive earthquakes to produce observed seismicity.

item.title: Jackson-PhilosTransA-2006
item.description: Fatal attraction: living with earthquakes, the growth of villages into megacities, and earthquake vulnerability in the modern world Authors: James Jackson Source: Philosophical Transaction A Abstract The great earthquake belt which stretches from the Mediterranean through the Middle East into Central Asia results from the ongoing collision between the Eurasian plate and the African, Arabian and Indian plates to the south.

item.title: On cooking
item.description: I started to cook, or thinking about cooking, during college. It was not because I finally left home. The college dorm and the shoebox studios for students and singles strongly forbid any kind of cooking.

item.title: OpenQuake
item.description: OpenQuake is a Python package created by the Global Earthquake Model foundation (GEM) for producing [[PSHA]] models. It does not support [[Python#Conda|conda]] install however.

item.title: Pandas
item.description: I am unable to leave pandas because I work with catalogs. But I hear good things about xarray Basic Dataframes Change column name: emme14.

item.title: Parallel computing
item.description: Intro The tutorial from the Lawrence Livermore National Laboratory And the one from ETH Parallel computer taxonomy by Flynn SISD: Base case of a single instruction stream and single data stream SIMD Single instruction: all processing units execute the same instruction at any given clock cycle Multiple data: Each processing unit can operate on a different data element MISD: multiband filter, code cracking MIMD: every computer now Jargons A node = a computer in a box execution units hardware threads Speedup and scalability Amdahl’s law Strong scaling If a fraction $p$ of your code execution time can be parallelized, then ideally the best speedup from parallelize it is $\frac{1}{1-p}$.

item.title: Personal knowledge management
item.description: During the pandemic, the craze of “personal knowledge management” took off. Loosely, PKM tools are referred to the note keeping apps that let you reference portions of the note I happened to try the famed web-based note service Roam Research.

item.description: I am a person that does not like writing and doesn’t write well. Of all the research works my least favorite is writing.

item.title: Python
item.description: Conda Remove tarballs, cache, etc: conda clean -a Managing environment create: conda create --name myenv python=3.6 Add new environment to ipython kernel python -m ipykernel install --user --name myenv --display-name "myenv" remove: conda remove --name myenv --all Related pages [[Pandas]] [[Making maps in Python|Making maps]]

item.title: Rewild
item.description: Return the land in its natural form Removal of the dam on the Klamath river in Oregon, USA. The dams are owned by PacifiCorp The largest dam-removal in US history The Economist’s report on dam removal presents both opinions from downstream Aboriginal communities and inland conservatives.

item.title: SCSS how-to
item.description: Length unit em size of the “M” letter. When used with font-size, it inherit the font size of the font size of the parent element.

item.title: Seismic Tomography
item.description: Finite-frequency tomography For my master thesis with Prof Shu-Huei Hung, I work with finite-frequency tomography to image the mantle below Basin and Range province, USA.

item.title: Simulate earthquake sequences in 3-D fault systems
item.description: How to create a [[modeling earthquakes|synthetic seismic sequence]]? Surely one can use the statistics to generate one. But we know plates move and faults slide.

item.title: Simulation
item.description: Choosing a model is the same as choosing a base functions. It’s the wavelength you choose to observe and describe the phenomena.

item.title: Statistical Seismilogy
item.description: Scaling laws Omori-Utsu law rate of aftershocks as a function of time t from the main-shock decays as $$\lambda(t)=K(t+c)^{-p}$$c, p: parameters

item.title: Strain rate to Seismicity Rate
item.description: Does the rate of surface deformation proportional to the rate of earthquakes? Can change in strain rate translate to change in seismicity rate?

item.title: Template Matching
item.description: Using known event waveform to systematically search for weaker events. Famous usages include David Shelly’s tremor research in Japan and Zhigang Peng’s works about dynamically triggered events is various palces.

item.title: TMUX
item.description: Â§ßÊäÑ New session with a name: tmux new -s foo List alive session, there can be multiple sessions: tmux ls

item.title: Uniform California Earthquake Rupture Forecast 3
item.description: The third Uniform California Earthquake Rupture Forecast (UCERF3) is the PSHA model of California. But because of the extensive fault and seismicity data available, the model is able to present the possible ruptures instead of low-activity area that rely on magnitude-frequency relations to estimate the hazard.
